content: Investments Asked by AnonymousAsked on 19 Jun 2018Must I set up a CDP account before I set up a POEMs account?4 answersAnswerBump0
Answers (4)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Sandy ChamLevel 3. WonderkidAnswered on 19 Jun 2018Yes. You would need a CDP account. Usually the brokerages will handle this. But u might want to shop around to get the best deals in terms of brokerage rates. 0 comments2

Gabriel ThamLevel 8. WizardUpdated on 07 Jun 2019Yes.​If you do not have an existing CDP account, do not worry, you can sign up for poems and sign up for cdp at the same time. POEMS will provide you the forms for CDP opening as well.​​1 comment2

Kenneth LouLevel 8. WizardAnswered on 19 Jun 2018Yup! The only brokerages which don't require a CDP are like Saxo and SCB. They are custodians who actually hold the purchased shares on your behalf, if I am not wrong.​Also, another way is to use the Bank's RSP (Regular Saving Plans) where they invest on your behalf monthly. You can find out more about these here: https://blog.seedly.sg/which-regular-savings-plan-is-the-cheapest/​With all that being said, would highly recommend for you to create a RSP as it is really fuss free and easy to do so also. It may take 1 week or so (which is kinda lame in today's time)  Cheers!0 comments1
James YeoLevel 4. ProdigyAnswered on 27 Jun 2018Yes. For more info, you can check out this link - https://www.smallcapasia.com/singaporeans-guide-to-buying-stocks/Cheers!0 comments0
